title.value: Влияние обеспеченности дерново-подзолистой легкосуглинистой почвы обменным магнием на урожайность и качество зерна кукурузы
Effect exchangeble magnesium in the podzoluvisol loam soil on the yield and quality of corn grain

journal.title: Soil Science and Agrochemistry : scientific journal

person.name: Markevich, D.V., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Arable Farming (Belarus). Institute for Soil Science and Agrochemistry

abstract.value: In course of the research there was studied influence of providing with exchangeable magnesium in sod-podzolic light loamy soil on yield and quality of maize (Zea mays) grain. The research was realized in the conditions of the Republic of Belarus in Minsk region in 2010-2011. The data of two years studies of grain maize yield in field experiment with exchangeable magnesium content in soil from low - 50 mg/kg-1 to high - 265 mg/kg-1 and varying K:Mg and Ca:Mg ratios 2.2-16.9:1 and 0.12-1.46:1 correspondingly was presented. It was found the highest grain yield -10.8-14.1 t/ha-1 at N110+30P60K120 application was obtained at Ca:Mg ratios 5.1-5.7 and exchangeable magnesium content 145-160 mg/kg-1. It was found that increasing of exchangeable magnesium content in soil from 50 up to 265 mg Mg/kg increased magnesium concentration in leaves of maize plants on growth stage of 6-8 leaves up to 1.7 times. At the same time concentration of nutrientes - calcium and potassium in maize plants leaves decreased with increasing of exchangeable magnesium content in soil.
